pullRequest.body:
This PR proves that to show that the unit of an adjunction `L ‚ä£ R` is an isomorphism (i.e. that L is fully faithful), it is enough to give an arbitrary isomorphism `L ‚ãô R ‚âÖ ùü≠ C`, and the dual result. 

To do this, we give a general way to transport (co)monad structures on functors along isomorphisms of functors.

---

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

Let's remove `Abstract` from the name, here and below, so just `unitAsIsoOfIso`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory): if LR is abstractly isomorphic to the identity functor, then the unit is an isomorphism.
